text.wiki:
The Lindenhof (lit.: courtyard of the lime) is a moraine hill and a public square in the historic center of Zürich, Switzerland. It is the site of the Roman and Carolingian era Kaiserpfalz around which the city has historically grown. The hilltop area—including its prehistoric, Roman, and medieval remains—is listed as a Swiss heritage site of national significance.


== Topography ==
Lindenhof (its northern part is called Sihlbühl) dominates the Lindenhof quarter in district 1 (Altstadt), the historical center of Zürich's Altstadt. To the North, it ends at Uraniastrasse (City police station) and to the South, it ends near St. Peter church. In the West, the hill is limited by the Bahnhofstrasse, and in the east, it ends at the Limmat and the Schipfe quarter.
Lindenhof sits atop the remains of a glacier. The hill and its public square are part of the Linth Glacier's moraines in the area of Zürich. The now largely flattened Lindenhof (428 m ü. M) rises about 25 meters above the Limmat.


== History ==


=== Prehistory ===

 

At the flat shore of Lake Zurich were Neolithic and Bronze Age (4500 to 850 BC) lakeside settlements, such as Kleiner Hafner and Grosser Hafner (both small former islands west of Sechseläutenplatz, near Bauschänzli at the Stadthausquai, Alpenquai at the Bürkliplatz square and Lindenhof). Lindenhof was largely surrounded by water: until the early medieval area, neighboring Münsterhof (Fraumünster abbey square) was a swampy hollow flooded by the Sihl. Therefore, Lindenhof was an optimal location for early fortified settlements. Middle bronze age (1500 BC) artefacts were found near the Limmat (Schipfe). Archaeologists found remains of a Celtic Oppidum from the 1st century BC (La Tène culture), whose remains were found in archaeological campaigns in the years 1989, 1997, 2004 and 2007 on Lindenhof and Rennweg.


=== Roman Vicus ===

In 15 BC, Augustus's stepsons Drusus and Tiberius integrated the territory on the left side of Lake Zurich into the Roman provinces Raetia and Germania Superior. Several stone buildings from the Roman period were located on and around the hill. It was part of the small vicus Turicum, located on both sides of the Limmat and connected by a Roman bridge located near the present Rathausbrücke. 
Turicum, Zürich's Roman name and possibly also its Celtic name, is engraved on a 2nd-century tombstone of a little boy. It was found on May 15, 1747, and it refers to the Roman STA(tio) TUR(i)CEN(sis). The tombstone is located in the Swiss National Museum; a copy is integrated in the Lindenhof wall at Pfalzgasse, leading to St. Peter church.
Using the topography, the Roman military built a citadel on top of the hill in the years of the Roman emperor Valentinian I (364–375), to defend migrations from the North by the Alamanni. It was 4500 square meters large, and it was fitted with 10 towers and two meter wide walls.


=== Medieval castle and graveyard ===
During the middle ages, the hilltop leveled fort became the retaining wall and gave the Lindenhof terrace a form similar to its current form. The remains of the Roman camp were used as the center of the later fortification of the historical center of Zürich. Significant parts of the lime mortar and ancient castle wall were integrated into the town houses around the Lindenhof and in a Kaiserpfalz (broken in 1218), which served as a place of festivities, including the engagement of the German emperor Henry IV with Bertha von Turin on Christmas in 1055. The Roman castle's remains existed until the early medieval age: a Carolingian, later Ottonian Pfalz (1054) was built on its remains. This Kaiserpfalz was a long building with a chapel on the eastern side of the fortified hill; it is last mentioned in 1172, and it was derelict by 1218, when its remains were scavenged for construction of the city walls and stone masonry on private houses.
In 1937, archaeologists found graves of late medieval children and adults that were oriented from the east to the west. In the year 1384, a chapel on the Lindenhof was mentioned, but no remains have been found. It is believed that the chapel was part of the processional axis Wasserkirche, Grossmünster and Fraumünster church processions that ended in 1524 or 1525 (Reformation in Zürich). These religious celebrations at Pentecost honored Zürich's Saints Felix and Regula and Exuperantius.


=== Modern public park ===

Following the demolition of the former royal residence, the hill—the only public park within the city walls—became an area for public life and relaxation, with dense tree vegetation, stone tables, crossbow stands, and bowling and chess; the latter are still very popular in modern times. According to a chronicle, fifty-two tilias (lime trees) were planted in 1774. Bow and crossbow-shooting was probably one of the most important leisure activities on the Lindenhof. Each Zürich guild had its own stone table, and the costumed guild members met on Sechseläuten for dinner, described by Gottfried Keller in his poem Ein Festzug in Zürich (a procession in Zürich, 1856).In August 1526, guests from St. Gallen were invited by the city councils and all the Guilds of Zürich for a dinner. The attendees of this dinner included Ulrich Zwingli, the prominent Zürich cleric; Leo Jud; Konrad Pelikan; Friedrich Myconius; and the Kappel abbey's abbot. 
The Hedwig Fountain (1688) was sculpted by Gustav Siber. It depicts the legend of the siege of Zürich in 1292 with a helmeted sculpture of the leader of the Zürich women. Under baroque influence, Lindenhof was converted in 1780 to a strictly geometrical park.
1851, the Masonic lodge Modestia cum Libertate (M.c.L.) bought the Paradies building and converted it into a lodge building with distinctive gables. At this time, coins, stove tiles and other artefacts from the Roman and medieval times were found. 1865, severe storm damage resulted in a redesign: Instead of Lime trees, the park was dominated for some years by chestnut and acacia trees. The redesign was not accepted by the population, and in 1900, Lindenhof Square was given its present appearance.
Today, there are numerous public events and festivals in addition to the historical guild dinner. The Square is also a tourist attraction. Cars are not allowed in the narrow streets to the Lindenhof.
Among the prominent historical visitors are Giacomo Casanova; Johann Wolfgang von Goethe; Johannes von Müller; Herzog Charles Augustus, Grand Duke of Saxe-Weimar-Eisenach; Johann Gottlieb Fichte; Anne Louise Germaine de Staël; Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel; Johann Ludwig Uhland; Franz Liszt; Richard Wagner and Johannes Brahms.


== Heritage site of national significance ==
The hillside area is listed as a Swiss heritage site of national significance, including the remains of its prehistoric Celtic, Gallo-Roman and medieval settlements and buildings.


== References ==


== Literature ==
Mauro Baster, Nicola Behrens et al.: Quartierspiegel Lindenhof. Präsidialdepartement der Stadt Zürich, Statistik Stadt Zürich (Hrsg.), Zürich 2006 (PDF; 2.77 MB). (in German)
Kunsthistorisches Institut (Hrsg.): Grüne Winkel in der City. Zürich 1997 (in German)
Andreas Motschi et al.: Eine Mauer kehrt ins Stadtbild zurück: Untersuchung und Sanierung der Lindenhof-Stützmauer. In: Archäologie und Denkmalpflege. Zürich 2003–2006 (in German)
Walter Baumann: Gang durch Zürich mit Walter Baumann. Band 1: Vom Lindenhof zum Fraumünster. Orell Füssli, Zürich 1987-1993 (in German)
Jürg Schneider, Jürg Hanser: Fenster in die Vergangenheit: Lindenhof, römische Thermen, St. Peter, Wasserkirche, Haus Zum Rech. In: Zürcher Denkmalpflege. Stadt Zürich, 1985/86 (in German)


== External links ==

Very near to lake Zurich, I watched the sunset over there. It is a park hence lifts up your kid's mood as well. And why not this is absolutely FREE, no tickets.

Getting here is in itself a walking treat. There many old buildings including churches and such to take in. Nice views of the city.

Walking thru Old Town Zurich on the west side, we came upon Lindenhofplatz, well at least we walked up the hill to it. It is a park with trees and some benches, but the main attraction is its high location overlooking the Limmat River. It offers great views of the river, the

We came here during our Zurich Old Town Walking Tour. It was on a small hill from where one can get get stunning view of Limmat river, Old Town, City Hall, Grossmunster Church and other places. It was a very quiet and romantic place. There were benches for the the people to sit,
A relatively easy walk up to here will provide you with some lovely inner city views of old town Zurich.

Worth the hillside climb to see the unobstructed view of the city lake traffic and the polytechnic institute across the lake. May not be suitable for people with mobility issues. Lots of benches and trees. Up the hill is the church with the largest clock face in Europe.
From this hill you have a very fine view to the river Limmat and the east part of Zurich. Moreover, close to the top there is a very old grave stone dating back to the Romans.
While exploring Old Town, Lindenofplatz is a great place to see the canal, find quiet and watch locals enjoying themselves.

It's such a quiet place in the middle of Zürich. Still there are many old lime trees, benches to take a rest. The view over the river with the Grossmünster church and the Wasserkirche.... You may as well see the right part of Zürichs old town. Very pitoresque. In 1798 the oath
You can walk in this part of city, see the spectacular view of the river and to the old city. The best pictures taken
A good but short climb from the Old Town to the "Platz", and here you get a good, and fairly close up view of the Limmat and the city center.

Visit the Lindenplatz for a scenic view over the old town of Zurich. It's great place to chill out a bit and romance moments.
It is another wonderful old church to see and enjoy. The walking tour takes you right by this. So much to see and do in the area.

It is just a tiny square on top of a hill. No grassy areas, just some benches. Decent amount of shade from trees. Nothing spectacular here, except maybe the views. It gets very crowded so be sure to come in the early morning. I much prefer the views and nature in Rieterpark.

Zurich was 14th & final day of travel. Family had hiked French & Swiss Alps. (Fatigued) As we walked by staircase, I’m glad I went up to this little park. I enjoyed the view of famous churches and river. I didn’t linger, but people can take a break on benches under the shade.

We spent most of our time in Switzerland in the alps and Lucerne so going to Zurich afterwards was just ok. Lindenhofplatz is just a square, nothing super impressive but we did catch some musicians playing beautiful classical music. Go, just don’t set your expectations too
A wonderful place to get a view over the river & of the old town. There’s a nice shaded courtyard in summer, with a large fountain.

It looks like Lindenhofplatz is a very usual park in Zurich. You can find tourists here viewing the scene. You can also find elders playing chess. However it's an old historical site of the Roman castle. Can't tell it was a castle before. However I like walking here to enjoy the

So beautiful and clean and green location and this visit i enjoyed very much. these location is very famous.

located on the left bank of the river Limmat in the old city, the Lindenhof is a little hill with a park on top, offering a great view down on the river and the old city, accross to the university and far around. definitely worth the bit of climb to get here.

Once you’ve taken the uphill walk you’re greeted with a beautiful area of greenery with a wall that boasts fantastic views of the River and parts of the City. Sit down, Relax, Take a book or a picnic and take in the atmosphere and the beautiful views.

As we were taking a walk we kept walking up & up until all of a sudden we were at this pleasant plaza with folks visiting, picnicking, playing bocce, site seeing as it affords a lovely view of the river and old town below. There are quite a few steps but definitely worth the
Right in the middle of the city, connecting the two banks of the Limit River,this is a great place to just stand and stare or even picnic.

This is a must do in Zurich. The walk up is not difficult. For those who are not too fit or elderly, just take it slow. There are hand rails to hold on to when you take the steps up. The views at the top are rewarding. It’s good to take a small lunch up and enjoy your food

Last week my partner and I went to Zurich for a daily visit and, after getting off the train, we headed straight to this viewpoint, from which you can admire a good portion of the city, the Grossmunster, the Limmat river and even the lake. It is free of charge, has a nice
Perfect view. Calm place and a great history. From here it's not far to many nice restaurants, unique shops, bars etc.
After a short easy walk up the hill we reached a garden which from it you can see the view of the old Zurich, the river and the lake. Worthwhile doing it.
It is a must in your visit to Zurich to go up to the City Park and enjoy the beautiful views from up there, taking lots of pictures and selfies! The views are amazing and relaxing!

The place has some nice views over the city, get some comfy shoes because you have to walk up - for a Swiss standard, its mostly flat, but in reality some might be out of breath. You can get some food and have a picnic on the top while enjoying the view.
Between that place and eth polyterasse, you get both views on either side of zurich city. Worth to walk from one to the other. Also by night

My family and i accidently found this place when we ask the guy whom we bought the famous swiss-made-knife. He told us about this place. Altought there were lots of stairs involve :), the sweat was worth every drop of it :))

Be forewarned, it is a climb of many stairs to get to it.I found workers setting up large platforms taking up the majority of space. To me it is more of a Sq than park as I didn't see grass. The view from front is nice. It looks down over Limatt and city.

Located at the old town of Zurich, 5 minutes walk to hauptbahnhof zürich. Good view point area where u can see the river, bridges, have a picnic with your friends and mind relaxing life-size chess board set up, my friends & I had wonderful time to roam around old town.
This was one of the two best things we did while visiting Zurich. They were both overlooks. That pretty much sums up my visit to Zurich. It is amazingly mundane.
A small park with a city view of Zurich. Located in the city center. A short hike from Bahnhofstrasse. Found this area while walking from city center going to Old Town.
As in the title, nice view of Zurich from an elevated angle. The view is okay, not exceptional and definitely not a standout place in Europe. But worth finding.

This square is fine, especially because of the magnificent views of Zurich below. Take some time to sit and appreciate the river bank with its cable cars and buildings, people strolling and life going by just below.

This place is a must in Zurich! You can have beautiful views of the city and the Limmat. In Lindenhofplatz you can also find chess-boards and play some matches! :) Both in Summer or Winter, It's always beautiful!

Lindenhof, the highest point in the old town. This used to be the location of the roman castle when the city was founded by the Romans, and now serves as a perfect panoramic point to observe the old town. The view from up there was very nice, and most of the eastern part of the

The surrounding wall at the top of the hill gives you an amazing view. There is also the story of this old Roman fort there! It’s a great walk through the city to get there. Shops and restaurants... enjoy it.

This is a place you cant miss in your walking tour. You will have a beautiful view of the old town and it is rigth in the middle of the city. people just seat and enjoy the view, play giant chess, take photos...

The best place in Zürich. The best place in the day and in the night. Beautiful park where you could see an amazing panorama of Zürich.

At the very center of the town, a very quiet place with nice view on the Limmat and a part of the old town. Perfect for a picnic in summer when it is not raining. Also the walk at the bottom of the hill along the river through is very special, one would almost feel back in the
It’s a must-do for everyone visiting Zurich! You get a beautiful view over the city and it’s for free!
Well worth a brief uphill walk to the top of the hill. The Lindenhofplatz has the very best views of Zurich -- great photo opp!

Its a charming park with a spectacular view of the city and a little lake. You need to climb a few stairs to reach the park but it is definitely worth it. Something peculiar I found about the park though is the fact that there is no grass but is replaced by pebbles. I would say

From a palace in the 12th century, and fortified into citadel for Zurich, and then after several centuries the citadel was removed and this place was transformed into the current open space. Now, its location and elevation make this Lindenhof City Park a scenic vantage point to

This is a very relaxed area of the city. It’s roughly located in the city center. Theirs a quiet park nearby. Overlooking the river with a drink is a nice way to unwind. If you feel up to it, you can walk to the top of the hill for some picturesque views of the city.
Easy place to reach when you are at the city center. Small slope up, just a few minutes walk. Both day and night views are good, you get to see a nice view of the city.

Highest point of Zurich City and the view of Limmat River and the old town is really marvelous. I went there as part of the walking tour and it is right place for taking few minutes rest in the small park and enjoy the view of the river and old town. There is a good water
The main place to go for a view of the city, open park area over looking the river and city. The locals use it to play chess and Pétanque an old ball game.
Great area, with lots of old narrow streets, great architecture and nice views of the city. Full of local people and tourists.

We went in November and it though it was cold for the Swiss, it was relatively nice out (for a Wisconsinite!)! The view is spectacular and you can get there just my searching it on the map!! Great FREE attraction for an expensive city!!

The roots of Zurich go back to this historic area in town. When we visited, there was a temporary exhibition that explained some history to it. The square is elevated and surrounded with basswood/linden trees and gives you a great view on the river Limmat and the lake of Zurich.

The Lindenhof Hill is listed as a Swiss heritage site of national significance. The views from the top of the hill which offer panoramic views across the city skyline is not to be missed. The hilltop area includes prehistoric, Roman & medieval remains.
This park is amazing, the view that offers of Zürich, is just great, and the colors of the leaves, the roofs and the river in autumn are wonderful! A place to stop, breathe and rest....
A beautiful place to spend just a few minutes or a few hours. Wonderful architecture and great views.

This was my first stop of my 2 weeks stay in Zurich. It was quite high up (but easy walk) so it will get you warm up to get up there. The view of the canel and the Zurich old town was amazing from there. I visiting this park many times during my stay to hang out with the local.
It was a nice walk in the afternoon during the Autumn, the maple leaves turned the floor into golden carpet! The view to the river and lake was great!

Located on the highest part of Zurich, this place makes you travel in the time, giving the opportunity to feel the ancient period.
If you’re passing through Switzerland like I was, then you have to stop in Zurich for the night. I think Zurich is a get hub to explore the surrounding area. Must see!
we stumbled upon this place by accident while wandering around. definitely a beautiful historic place to view the river and old town across.
very nice path to walk through with beautiful scenery . there aren't much attractions in Zurich anyhow so go for it...

While walking along the banks of the Limmat River, we saw a bunch of people on a hilltop and decided to go there. It's a nice quiet area (at least when we got there) with a view of river and Grossmunster. It's a good place to take pictures if you're itching for that
We have been in the Zurich in September . Weather was very nice. Lindenhof area has nice site seeings to visit , very unique and colorful buildings. Water fountain in the middle .

I read about the beautiful view and I saw ok a view. If your time is weekend, you have to prefer other things

I noticed this hill whilst walking along the banks of the Limmat river. Decided to explore this and found at the top of the hill beautiful views of the river overlooking to the University and the iconic twin towers of the Grossmunster. It is like a old town square with benches

A short walk through the town and up to Lindehof Hill was awarded with spectacular views over Zurich Old Town with the Cathedral towering over the town. Views of the harbour and river renowned for the beautiful white swans that grace the river.

I spent one day in Zurich and tried to see as much as possible. My stop at Lindenhofplatz came at the perfect time, as I was ready to sit down, relax, and take in the beautiful view. The park itself isn't the highlight. It's definitely worth it to stop for the view and
At the top of Zurich, there is a hill with chessboards and a beautiful view. The chessboards are in the back (a little hard to find).

Easy to get to by foot from the Zurich main train station and is quiet place to step back, relax and take in a few minutes of quiet from a vantage point that has good views of the city and Limmat River.
Great location for an over view of Old town Zurich and Limmat River from the top. There are benches you can sit on under trees and enjoy the beautiful vista of the City. Highly recommended.
Nice stroll up to a beautiful view of the city! It is a quick stop- nothing there to do really, but it is lovely.
It is somewhat a steep uphill approach reaching this park . Many people stay here chatting , taking photos , admiring the views. Some play games , drink beer or something. Worth the short visit .
Recommended place to just chill , admire the views , take as much photos as you want . Many tourists go here so you will be jostling a little bit for your own space.
This is a nice and quiet area and you get an excellent view over the city for free! They sometimes have things going on up there like little stalls or games. Well worth a visit.

We found this overlook area on our old town walk. the views along the riverfront are very good for pictures. There is also a fountain with great Swiss drinking water which we welcomed on a very warm day.

This area offers great views of the river and city sites. It is also of historical significance and was built on a Moraine. They way up is an incline but not too strenuous if you take your time. It is worth the effort.

On your way up to the Lindenhofplatz for views of Zurich and the Limmat river, you will pass through the narrow winding streets of Old Town Zurich. Worth the quick walk up for the views. Loved this area of Zurich!
This is the most beautiful overview of the city of Zurich. An easy walk from Paradeplatz stop on Zurich city streetcars. Highly recommended!
This is just a small hill, but has great views over the river and city. A must do as its central to Zurich and easy to get to.
Nice and quiet place for views over the Altstadt. Would be a nice place for a picknick as well. Need to climb some stairs to get here.

This public spot has one of the best views of the old town Zurich. It really worths the visit. Although, it lacks a happier atmosphere. It would be a very nice spot for a biergarten, for instance. Nevertheless, this spot offers great views.

The park has a nice view overlooking Limmat River and the West side of Zurich. You have to walk up some steps to get there but it is worth the trek! There is also an information board in the park which tells you about the history of the area.

The Lindenhof offers plenty of space to sit and relax in the shade with a great view of the city. It is a quiet oasis. Sit by yourself, bring something to eat and visit with friends or watch people play boccia or chess. You can even take a turn on the swings.

In the middle of Zurich's lovely Old Town, Lindenhof is a popular viewpoint over the river and the picturesque Niederdorf area. It is also the scene of open-air draught and pitanque games. It is,however, also the location of some grossly-understated historic interest. Occupied
This is a really beautiful spot where you get a nice view over the city of Zürich, I really recommend you visit it if you're in the city.

This park is definite worth a visit. There is some interesting history behind this park as well. You get a great view of the river and of Zurich across the river. You can also watch some locals playing chess on giant chess sets.

The Lidenhofplatz is a square on top of one Zurich's hills. You have great views of the city and the Limmat. There's a giant chess table and you can see people playing. It's just 10-15min walking from the lake.
The climb up the hill is worth it. A beautiful small park square, with beautiful views. Enjoy the panoramic views and some fresh water from the fountains on the top. a great spot to take a break!

Personally it wasn't my best view in Zurich (I found Lake Zurich more encapsulating), but it is still a decent view of the city. Central part of Zurich (10min walk from Zurich Hbf) and easy to walk up. We got here at 830am so the park area as well is also very peaceful so you

The Lindenhof square is situated near the wider side of the zurich river, it also has a belvedere looking over the river.
An area around the wider part of lake zurich, quiet and peaceful. Good for a stroll or a takeaway meal by the lake.

Lindenhof Park has a fantastic view of Zurich’s old town and the river. Best time to visit is at night. Nice walk up a steep hill but is definitely worth a visit. A nice quiet and relaxing park in the heart of Zurich.

Excellent stop just a stones away from the busy cosmopolitan Bahnhofstrasse. On a sunny day help yourself to a refreshing water top up and enjoy the panoramic view of Limmat, Fraumunster Great spot for a quiet lunch and spectacular views From here walk towards the Polybhan and
We walked up to this place just for the views and we got a history lesson too. Very neat place that ever visitor should see.

We stumbled into this park after seeing the Fraumunster Church. It's a lovely quiet place to have a picnic lunch. (Coop is in the neighborhood so you can get your lunch there). We enjoyed reading the history of the place on the signs there. We enjoyed the view overlooking this
From here you can take the most beautiful photos and memories of the ancient city of Zurich and enjoy the magnificent views of the river

A quite park located in the centre of the city... Great for evening walk and offers a great lake and city view
A shady park with a great view of the altstadt. Apparently built over the remains of a castle. I would definitely include this on a walking tour of Zurich

I went here with my sister, who lives in Zurich, and we loved the view, we didn't take the whole tour, but just walking up here was worth it! There were some people playing chess and it was really fun to watch!

Lindenhofplatz is a great place to see nice views of Zurich. With the river below you and the Universities across the river, it makes it easier to see how the city is laid out. Definitely worth a stop in Zurich.
Whenever we have visitors we make our way to the Lindenhofplatz to take in the views of the city, the rooftops opposite and the river below us.
The view from the hilltop is absolutely amazing. Visitors can enjoy a wide panorama of Zurich city centre and even mountains. Very nice place to have a rest.
A slightly uphill walk leads visitors to one of the best places in Zurich. Lindenhof is a historic neighborhood with an excellent view of the Limmat. The park at the hilltop is lovely.
it was a bit hard to find but once you get there the view is very nice and calming...great photo ops as well
A bit quieter you get to look over the old city for a good picture. A lot more locals than tourists.

Out of the things Zurich has to offer, Lindenhof was probably the one I liked the most. The streets have this quaint feel to it and as we walked to the square I wanted to take pictures of every single door as their designs are beautiful in a simple kind of way. Once you get to
Walk around, feel the atmosphere! It is a beautiful place to spend an hour looking around. Lots going on and lots of people also. Many stores and local mini markets.
You have to really stretched your hand if you want to do proper photo of the city as it is partly cover by buildings roof's. Nice platz with plenty space to sit down and relax.
A high ground with a reach history and historic monument of a women who is a symbol of women's bravery during one of ancient wars .great location to catch memorable pictures of Zurich.
Nice walk to this location. Lovely view often the city. Information display provided. Seats to enjoy the view.
One more place to visit and see the city of Zurich from the western bank/ One can make good pictures. There are some play grounds: chess, etc.
Was part of our walking trail. Enjoyed and is an excellent Photo opportunity from the top. Not to be missed for the view and take lots of photo.
If the weather is nice, a climb to the top of this lookout spot provides a perfect place to sit and take in a nice view across the beautiful city.

Walking up to Lindenhofplatz is a must during a trip to Zurich. The hill is accessed via steps at the side of the lake. At the top there are exhibition boards explaining the history of the area, which is an interesting read. Then just take in the views!!! It's a really good
You can reach it easily via walking just 30 mintues from the city centre and nice place to take photos and look at city from above
One of the best place to take photos As you can have panorama view for the city and easy to get through by walking
The views from Lindenhof across Old Town are stunning, Great spot to take a couple of photos. There is also a very interesting storyboard showing the history of this location itself. Highly recommend

We visited Lindenhofplatz at night so we can enjoy a few amazing views of Zurich old town. From there you can see almost every attraction. Night shots at old town and Grossmunster are breathtaking and relaxing. It’s not so difficult to get there (as every other hill) but you
I was out for a walk through town and happened upon this site. The view looking over the river and city was just great! It is definitely worth ones time to stop here and enjoy the view.

The Lindenhof is a hill in downtown Zurich. In fact, the place was a Celtic fort, later turned into a Roman military camp (Turicum), from which sprang the city of Zurich. Enjoy the view over the Limmat River and onto the Univiersity and ETH buildings.
Great views over the old town, eventhough you're in the old town. Just near all the Shops, benches to sit down

I walk through Lindenhof almost every time I visit Zurich. It's just a great part of the old town, just steps off Bahnhofstrasse and Rennweg, as well as the upscale shopping area of the old town on that side of the river, located between St. Peter's church, Fraumuenster Church

Zurich is just a beautiful city but from Lindenhofplatz you really get to enjoy it more and really appreciate the view of the city. We went on a rainy cloudy day but the view was well worth it. It is easily accessible by foot and you will not be disappointed especially with

If you like a great and (something you don't hear much in Switzerland) free sight with a really nice view over the River and the Oldtown than head up to this small square. It's also a very historic place as about 2000 years ago this hill was the location of a roman castle. It's
Great view of Zurich! A beautiful area for a stroll as well, pack some sandwiches and drinks you're good to go.
We stumbled upon this park walking around the old town just before sunset. Fantastic views of Zurich make it worth the uphill walk. There is also some playground equipment for younger children.

After a short walk over the river, we found this amazing little place which gave up views over Zurich. Well worth the walk up to be able to look out over the city. Wonderful photo opportunities. Don't miss it.
The classic Lindenhofplatz offers a gorgeous overview of Zürich, overlooking the river and rooftops. It's a perfect place to get your bearings in the Altstadt.
Nice place to wander... and shopping. The prices are not too big. many opportunities to have a beer, free wi-fi almost everywhere, and excellent views to photograph !
Must visit place during evening to capture amazing pics with old Town and Limmat river in background.. you will find many locals playing outdoor chess as well.
We visited this place in evening... It offers a great view of city and photo taking opportunity. There are few outdoor chess set up as well to keep you engaged...

We went up here late afternoon for the views over the old town. We were not disappointed. In the receding daylight we were had views of the old town as it was illuminated by street lights. It a must go to location when you are in Zurich. You will not be disappointed.
A must for any visitor to Zurich. Best place for photos over the river and old town. Watch the guys playing bocce and chess, despite the weather.
I loved just sitting up there and relaxing for a while. There’s always so much activity and things going on, and it makes great pictures which is a plus!
What better views can one get than from Lindenhofplatz in Zurich, and affords panoramic views for beautiful photos!
worth taking a trip up the steps to see great views of the city! next to it there is also a playground for children and public bathrooms
Marvelous pano photo op! Great view of the city from up here and fun little alleys to get lost in on the way down. Nice park.
Did a ton of walking in Zurich, but this was the nicest view of a portion of the city. It was quite busy up there even when its cold and raining.
Client took me there for a walk, it is a nice little quiet park, a little above the town, great view of the river. Worth to go!

Arrived at the hill top in the morning so i managed to beat the crowd and enjoy the cooling and quiet view of the Zurich city. It is November so everything is cold / drizzling and without the green but the worth the trip.

This little park is where you can enjoy the view of Zurich and relax between walks. Would recommend to vistit!
It is reachable via a busy street up the hill from the city center and provides the best view of the city.

If you are around a city center, I recommend to spend at least 10 minutes ia this park. There are a lot of benches, and the view is very nice .. a good place to bring your sandwitch and enjoy the view :)

I often will take a detour going from one side of downtown to the other in order to cross the Lindenhof and have a peek over the river to the old town. It is a pretty little park near excellent restaurants and shopping. The only time not to visit is during SeschiLuut - when it

While in Zurich, take advantage of every single thing that is free. Lindenhof is DEFINITELY one of those places. Our favorite pictures are from here. It's not a place where you would spend a lot of time, but it's worth the few minutes!

Wishing to take home more photographic memories of our visit, I consulted my guide book in hopes of finding a location that would provide a panoramic view of the old town. This site, high above the river, offered a spectacular vantage point. Named for the Linden trees which
At the top of a hill in the old town, you get to this square with beautiful views of the city and river. Definitely worth the little climb.

We found our way up here on a fairly quick visit to Zurich. It was unfortunately a cold and wet Sunday so our photos do not do it justice. There is history on the site going back to Roman times. Now though it is really a very attractive place to get a good view over the
We read about Lindenhofplatz and finally went on our last day. It was bright and sunny and lots of people were out enjoying. Lots of chess going on, photo opps, and people relaxing, and petanque.
Take a break hear for a moment and take in the Swiss fresh air. Nice view for photos. You see a lot of Zurich from this point.
There is a big history associated with this place. Please read every information available at the square and overlooking Zurich town below and the Lake Zurich.
Great square with lots of restaurants, in the center of Zurich. would recommend it if you are in Zurich.

A cozy square under the trees overlooking the river and partly over the roofs of the old town. The visit up here is even more worthwhile if you combine it with a walk: recommended tour, from Bahnhofstr up Rennweg and left at the top. Time permitting go back via Strehlgasse to
Great place for an amazing view over the city, to relax and enjoy people watching! Easy way to experience this wonderful city.

Lindenhof is this uphill location which opens up to a beautiful view of Zurich. A good thing is that the walk to the top is not very vigorous. Just a few steps honestly. It can be accessed by wheelchair users and parents with prams. My suggestion for a great time here is: take a
You do not need to be a professional. All pictures from here are amazing and fantastique. Lindenhof hill is a must. A place to good selfie with your love ones

Quaint little place to relax, just sit down and even read a book. It's only a short climb up a slope. Worth visiting if you are nearby, I hung out there for about 20min. But 10 min suffice if you just want to take photos.
This place is definitely worth going to! Pleasant hilltop with charming streets on your way to the top. Also a good place to take some photos and chill.

We hiked through the old city to the hill to find this green oasis filled up with Linden trees in Zurich. This site is historical dating back to Roman times. An old roman castle was built here. After it was destroyed it was rebuilt by the Germans. Later on, Lindenhof became a a

Laid back park which you can reach after some walk and hike. For older adults to know, there is close to 100 step climb to get here. The place is meant for relaxing, playing chess, enjoying city views and reminiscing about your time in Zurich.

A lovely place where one can not only relax in the shade rather also enjoy a beautiful view of the old city, the universities and river Limmat. I would recommend this place especially to the people who are on a short trip to Zurich. Located just a few minutes walk from the main

Lindehof is a very pleasant hilltop square located on the area were Zurich was founded and is now one of the loveliest spots int the city. The square and the little streets around it are rich in history (medieval buildings, Roman remains, fountains, defensive walls), have great
Took your time to walk up the stairs to Lindenhofplatz from Old Town Square. You will have the best photograph of Zurich's amazing sights.
It took a bit of navigation through the back streets to find the street heading up to the lookout, but it's all part of the fun of walking around Zurich. The view from up top is lovely and a must-do.
It's always nice to visit Lindenhofplatz. It's relaxing, and it offers nice view to the city. It's a perfect spot for photo shooting.

During our first visit to Zurich, 2 years ago, we did not visit Lindenhofplatz, simply because we did not know about it. However, a little bit of research in preparation for our 2nd visit to Zurich indicated that it was one location that we must visit. It was a little difficult
This is a great place to sit and have your packed lunch, or even just relax. You get amazing views of the city and there is lots of seating
The Lindenhofplatz is a shaded park in the oldest portion of town. It is elevated above everything, and you get the classical vistas of Zurich. Worth the climb up.
This is a must see place for tourists and for people who just moved to Zurich. It's a quiet place full of threes and from there you can take nice pictures of the river.

The Lindenhof is the old city fortification. As such, it requires a bit of climbing to get to. The plaza is pleasantly shaded, with benches and bocce players. The views over Zurich are iconic. Definitely the place to get the "Holiday card" photo with a great view.

slightly up hill, the square under the shadow of linden offers a great view of the university, city hall and main reform church across the river. there is an area for children. it is easy to locate from the main train station (actually the route from there is quite nice).
You can get there in 5 minutes from the center and get a really nice view of the river and the city.
Back a years before kingdom and kings settled among the people. Town with a pride it is. A town with a dignity.
Steep steps up to the viewing terrace, plenty of seating under the trees and by the viewing area. Lovely views in the day and evening make it an essential visit.

Only had a little time here because we had a 5 hour stopover in Zurich, but if you ever find yourself stuck at zurich airport you should definitely take the short 15 minute train ride to the city center and explore the town!! This park is situated near the edge of the shopping
It was well worth the walk up the steep hill to get an amazing view over the river and city with the Alps as a backdrop. Bring your bottle of vino and enjoy the view. Its breath-taking.

The entrance into this small park is via 2 narrow steps (one on each side) leading up from the neighbourhood below. You would probably not think of coming here unless it was pointed out to you. It is to the east of the Bahnhofstrasse and quite easy to miss as you can't see the
The view isn't that great. It's way up a great big hill. Much effort without much reward at the end.
Walking up to Lindenhof is a pleasant stroll, but worth it when the views of beautiful Zurich are before your eyes. Worth the time, and lovely for a picnic if you bring some lunch or wine!
This is definitly a hidden gem of zurich. Not many tourists find there way up here and it is definitly a place to stop and catch your breath. Very romantic little Corner of the city.
A very nice place for a good walk, and to snap some pictures from the top of the hill, and to relax a little bit..
Nice little stroll uphill to get a nice view of the old town of Zurich and take one of the better pictures that Zurich has to offer.
We visit there around 10 pm to see night view. The view was nice. It was not far from the town.
Quiet, and beautiful square, just 2 minutes from Bahnhofstrasse. Definitely worth the detour. There are some beautiful views of the river.
A friend of mine introduced this place. He said if you are in Zurich, I should see the view from this Lindenhof, and he is absolutely right. Best view from top of Zurich
Lindenhof has a beautiful view of the Altstadt and the river. It also has quite an interesting history, and is definitely worth a visit.

Located in old Town; The Lindenhof park is a perfect place to get a fabulous view of the Limmat (river) and Zurich. It offers a great place to sit and enjoy a take-away meal or just catch one's breath after shopping and sightseeing
Lindenhofplatz is a must see as the view of the river and across to the university area is very nice. The platz has trees and a few benches, but otherwise is not of much interest.
Is a wonderful spot and park to enjoy a panoramic view of Lake Zurich and the river from a few hundred feet above the ground. It is a very nice spot and worth visiting.
Lindenhof is my most favourite place in Zurich. A historical site with nice views towards the lake and the old town on boths sides. An absolute MUST GO if you visit the City.
Happened upon this place on accident while wandering around town and was pleasantly surprised. Great views of the city that were unobstructed - nice park to hang out in and enjoy the views!

Good place to pause and soak in the view across the river. Not too many people, but sufficinet foot traffic that there is no grass in the park and there are few places to sit. Could be much better with a little more maintenance.
When you want to have view parts of Zurich, visit this place. Easy to access. Near other places of interest.

Wanna see the Vieuw over the old town? Than visit this place. During the day People Play the game jeu de boule. in the eavning you have a great vieuw over the lights of the old town. Nice for half an hour.
This small park sits above the river in the middle of the Old Town so its great to see over the river and the Old Town. Easy walk up the ramps from either side of the park.

walk up the rambling alleys of the Lindenhof side of the old town -- as long as you're going up, you'll end up there -- and find one of the best spots for a picnic or a break and a breathtaking view over most of the city -- particularly the other side of the river's old town -
you can get some cool nice views of the city from here. Not too high up and a quick walk from anywhere in the city you are in.
An easy walk from central Zurich lies Lindenhofplatz which is an attractive park - like area with excellent views of Zurich. It'd be s hood place to enjoy a picnic on a Summer's day or evening.
Our tour guide brought us up lovely shopping and residential streets to enjoy the well groomed park with the lovely city view. It was worth the walk.
Very easy to reach from Bahnhofstrasse/Rennweg. Great views over Gross Münster and other central sights of Zürich

Accessible, just a 10-15 minutes walk from the Zurich HB, climbed up a short and mild slope from the street and u will know that u have arrived when u see a platz with many people sitting, taking rest and pictures. This is really a perfect and comfortable spot with mild wind to
it is worth the walk through the winding streets of the old town to find this lovely plaza with an enchanting view of the city below.

visited this place early morning, 40 minutes brisk walking from our hotel (near the central station), easy walking track with some a bit steep, sweating but worth the beautiful view of Zurich river and old town
From the Lindenhofplatz you have a beautiful view over the City. Lovely during the day and night. It's a pitty that it don't have much possibilities to sit.

It one of the most interesting sites that combines leisure, views and history. Its a very nice spot not far from the Bahnhofstrasse overseeing a large portion of historic Zurich. The ETH and university of Zurich where most famous Scientists roamed. Looking to the right is also

Definetely a must if you are visiting Zurich. On the way, there are nice small boutiques, but dont lose too much time there and enjoy the view from Lindenhof asap. Also dont forget to grab something to drink on the way if you want to enjoy your drink with one of the best Zurich

Right after we arrived in the city - this is the first place we went. When doing research on what to do, this was one of the suggestions. It has great views, and gives you a layout of the city. There were quite a few people up here taking pictures and enjoying the day.

Lindenhofplatz is an ancient wall above Old Town in Zurich. It has a really nice view of the Limmat. You can easily reach it by foot from Old Town or anywhere in the city center. When we were there they had some tents set up to celebrate Sechlauten but it was still not too busy

My wife and I visited lindenhofplatz... we were tired after all day walking but this was an easy climb.. about 4 floors (that's what my iPhone tracked). I suggest buying a beer and pizza from La Piazza and sit on the ledge and enjoy the beautiful view...
Such a beautiful view once you climb the steps to this site. I would love to sit on the wall and have a picnic if we'd been there during warmer, non rainy, weather.

We stopped there for more than half an hour and there was a play ground. Children had a lot of fun. There were some people playing chess. There is a fountain to drink, lots of trees and also the view is great. It is very easy to reach on foot from the center.
If you can handle a short walk (uphill) it's worth visiting Lindenhof for the view you get of Zurich Old Town from across the water. Definite photo spot!
Definitely worth the short walk and climb to the Lindenhof to get the wonderful view of the Zurich Old Town from across the water

We stumbled upon this park by mistake when wandering around Zurich between flights. In fact, it is where the original Roman settlement or fort stood in Roman times. You wouldn't know that as nothing is signed It has gorgeous vantage points over the city, places to sit, chess
Though snowing for a while and with chilling wind- the view from Lindenhoff is spectacular. After crossing the Limmat in front of the Rathaus- just keep climbing and you will get up there.
A wonderful little viewing area and garden in the middle of the cobbled streets of Zurich city. Gorgeous views over the rooftops and river.

Great views, and very calming to see the city from overhead. Great way to still be in the city, but feel as though you are surrounded by nature with a city view.
it's the first place I take visitors when we start our "tour of Zurich". Shade from the trees, fountain, view of the Limmat, benches. Ideal place to start taking pictures.

All the guide books mention it, and on maps it looks like a big open park, but but its not that easy to find. You need to get yourselves lost in the cobbled lane-ways north of the Fraumunster and take the high roads. If you're climbing, you're getting closer! And boy is the
We managed to find it by accident by walking, the views are amazing so I would recommend anyone to go and have a look.
Relaxing park in the midst of the old town. Beautiful views, huge floor chess boards. Playground for kids at lower level.

This is a great place to get your bearings in Zurich. It is on a rise above the Limmat. While the views are not that dramatic, you get a good sense of the city and it is in the midst of some lovely streets. Well worth the visit.

Sure the view is fine but down below on the river side I eventually found the Lindenhof Roman Ruins down a little lane and covered with heavy grating. The remains reveal a bath house and part of the foundations of the Fort that lie beneath the entire Lindenhof hill where it was
Just go there and enjoy the view, Good to visit both day and night. Highly reccomended, combine with walk around old city
Lindenhof hill offers nice view both in the night and during the day. A must visit and enjoy the view after walk around the old town.

It's worth seeing the whole area and so many places to stop to eat and shop. The scenery is incredible. Churches, gardens, and music everywhere. People are so friendly here. They have boat rides and that is fun too. But I enjoyed walking and seeing all the churches and old

If you are able to find this spot then it is well worth a visit on a sunny day. There is a small park for kids, but the key attraction is the view overlooking Lake Lemmatt from the South/West side. Do take a trip up to here if you want to see the north side of the city from

If you're looking for a relaxing spot in Zurich, then this is it. A nice hill with a beautiful view of the river and Zurich. You will have to do a little bit of walking and stairs before you reach it, but it's worth it. Has a great park with swings and giant chess boards.

Lindenhofplatz is a pretty inspirational and romantic spot... go there on a summer night and you'll feel like on cloud 9!!! the view on the old town of zurich is amazing and the people up there are always with good vibes...

The Lindenhof park is a perfect place to get a fabulous view of the Limmat (river) and Zurich. It offers a great place to sit and enjoy a take-away meal or just catch one's breath after shopping and sightseeing. It is particularly beautiful and fragrant in June when the linden
Beautiful view and relaxing place with lovely clean air. Nice to be able to stroll around without any hassle!

just a little hill with a tiny park, but sitting with my feet dangling down on that old wall watching the view over the river and the old city was beautiful and very peaceful. In the middle of the city very accessible a short climb up the alleys.
I sometimes do tours in Zurich, when I have foreign visitors. This is a place, I always go. It's so close to the mainstation, it's peacefulll and it is great for taking pictures.

Lindenhof gives you a fine view of Zurich in all its beauty, with the river cutting through it. It's definitely a walk that you must take if you want to see the city in all its glory, especially at night!

It's quite a climb to get to the top but once you're there, it's well worth it. You're treated to a view with the town below you and the snow capped mountains in the backdrop. It's indeed a sight to behold!
You'll get some amazing views of the cityscape from up here. It's a bit of a walk as you'll be going uphill, but worth the trek to get a panoramic view of Zurich.
Whenever I am close to Lindenhofplatz I just have to stop by and sit on the wall for a short break. The view, the trees around... Awesome
a small garden that offers probably one of the best views over Zurich city. Worth definitely a visit to take some pictures for future reference.
Great view over the river and old town. Frequented also by locals playing Boccia. Great way to explore the rest of the old town on this side of the river Limmat.

We walked here for our hotel to meet a friend and we were pleasantly surprised by the view, it was lovely looking over the river and at the old church. It's worth the walk up to the park and it would be beautiful in summer
Wander around the narrow winding streets and head up here for a great view over the river and old town. Perhaps on a sunny day bring your packed lunch up here
A place to stop by and enjoy the view: The skyline of the Limmat. Combine it with a stroll through the old town.

This hilltop park is a serene open space with views, and the surrounding neighborhood contains narrow winding streets and old buildings. Cross to the other side of the river for more restaurant selections and more favorable prices if you are on a budget in this expensive city.
Very close to the main shopping street Bahnhofstrasse, the Lindenhofplatz provides good views over the Limmat river and also towards Zurichsee (Lake Zurich). Well worth the short climb.

Would my way up the streets to get to this square that overlooks the city and canal. You get great views and the place seems very popular with all types. Could spend a bit of time simply people watching and taking in the views.

Lindenhofplatz in Zurich is one of those places where people just know how to get to. Located in old part of Zurich, one of the most attractive thing about it is that it gives you a bird’s eye view of Zurich Old Town, the City Hall, Grossmunster Church, etc. This hillside park

This was a very quick stop off on the way to other things but it was well worth the visit. You get views from over the river nearby over the east side of Zürich. There's also giant chess sets if you fancy a game while you're there.
This is an amazing place in the heart of the city. What a great view of the river. you can get there easily using different modes of transport.It is normally a crowded place.
It is a natural photo booth for tourists. There are benches and some pigeons flying around. It is on top of a hill and the view is stunning.
Best place to get a close up view of the old city. It will be crowded with tourists in summer, or any other day with decent weather, so take your time to enjoy the view and snap your pictures.

Beautiful place in the heart of Zurich, on top of a hill from which you can enjoy a unique view on the river, the Niederdorf and much more. In summer it is fantastic to be under the cool shades of the trees. You can reach from different directions walking through the beautiful

It stopped raining as we entered Lindenhofplatz; vacant except for the pigeons. We couldn't sit, the benches were wet. As we stood, the sky cleared and we had sunny views of Zurich. Don’t miss this photo opportunity.
Christmasy Zurich at night offers a wide range of colorful lights. Seeing them from above makes quite a beautiful sight.
From the parkland you get a great view of the city. You overlook the old part of town and get a different perspective of the city
It was a cold and damp day so when finally reaching this look out point it was muddy. It was not a sunny day but grey unfortunately but you could still see out across the town
A must place to bring anyone visiting given the great views of offers of the old town of Zurich. Make sure you walk down to the 3 main big churches and visit those too.
If you want a great view of the Grossmünster, river, lake and alps, head up to the Lindenhof. It is definitely worth it. And in summer, you can sit under a tree and enjoy the breeze.
I would not have known about this gem if not for TripAdvisor. Well worth the walk! If we hadn't had a tight schedule, we would have spent a lot more time here.

One of Zurich's most stunning sceneries. Perfect for lunchbreaks or pre-drinks. One can overlook the universities, the Limmat river and the beautiful old town area of Zurich. There's also a chess game open for the public. Best time to visit is when the sun sets.

This is a nice garden with a sightseeing area for part of the city. it is really good to see a bit of the river, also if you want to play chest they have a gigantic chest area or any other traditional street games. a bit full of people but still good.
nice little square/garden that you can go to enjoy and see the city and the river, a good sightseeing place.

Super easy to find and very central, a short walk will get you to this spot where you will find lovely views over the old town of Zurich. Doesn't take long but it's a must for at least a couple of photos!

Nothing special except a cute city park with some amazing views of Zurich. There is an ancient Roman gravestone you should check out, too! When the sun is out, don't pass up taking some gorgeous photos of the city. Or watching all the kids and tourists taking selfies! When you
Best with good weather but anyway you can enjoy a lovely view over the old town and up to the univercity and ETH. Locally situated you can find restaurants and bars nearby.

All roads lead to this view. I'd say its easy to find but my husband couldnt find it. Go early because it gets crowded. Its a small park where people hang out or take their dogs. Most people go to photograph the view

its a nice short walk up the little hill with a fantastic view of the town and overlooking particularly the Limmatquai and the Limmat river On the way up/down experience the nice little restaurant (s) Recommended on a clear and sunny day - its shady up there with plenty of trees.
You can get a beautiful scenery from here, because it's quite high from the street... if you have a good camera, you can take a good picture from here

Visit Lindenhofplatz and have a picking at the benches while watching elderly men play pétanque or chess, or you can simply enjoy the panoramic view of Zürich. The local people are chatty even though their English is limited. There are big outdoor chessboards for everyone to
Very nice, beautiful spot in the city centre. Worth visiting. You will get lovely photos over Zurichs rooftops. This litltle park is very popular amongst the locals as well.

Came here looking to get some nice photos of Zurich although found the view across the river a little underwhelming, compared to street level where you get a better view of the skyline. However, this park was a vibrant place with lots of locals enjoying themselves. People were

The staircase to reach here is beautiful. As soon as we reached the top, we found three large chessboards with people standing around it and playing. Watching Limmat from top is a joy! It's accessible easily by tram. Worth one visit.

Such a quiet and relaxing spot in the heart of Zurich. People play chess and pétanque and is so nice to watch them. A bit hidden, but you only have to climb like 3 or 4 minutes from the main street from the river, is the place that will steal your heart as the view is amazing,
Very nice view over Zurich from the top of the banks over the river. Great spot for a view and a nice little park
During our visit by foot, the guide brought us up here. She explained why there was only a park, no shops, no stands, ... Just a park for reading, playing chess, admiring the view.
nice location for panorama of the Limmat and Niederdorf / university ETH tower / east side of Zürich.

Wonderful view of the city from the park on the side of the hill. After shopping, climb up and see the view. Worth the walk to relax for a few minutes. The area seems to be popular with locals as well.

An evening walk around here is very relaxing and fun. You can grab traditional food at the eateries around here and also satisfy your shopping bug. Its a mix of old and new buildings and you can also get an insight into the history over here. even if you dont want to move
We were in a hurry but wanted to see the panaromic view of the city. A scenic view from hill top. The localites were enjoying their weekend at this place. Overall view of limmat river & the city.

Amazing place to visit when you are in Zurich downtown.. The landscapes of Altstadt Zurich from this please really very good & also good for having some good pictures for photography lovers.. cant be missed in daytime as well as night..

This place is located centrally in the downtown Zurich.. easily walkable & well connected even by public transport.. We went to this place in the daytime as well as night & it is worth visiting this place..

This was a wonderful find. We walked up this steep street only to be rewarded with amazing views of the city, old men playing chess, people taking selfies with the entire city in the background. We were there in the day and then went back for amazing pictures at night.

The Lindenhof is a tiny green park with a good view of the old town and Grossmünster. Originally a Roman fort it is now a tranquil place away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Plenty of seats and an excellent place to take photographs.

This is the place where sometimes I walk early in the morning to enjoy the beautiful view fo the river and the city of Zurich. Sometimes you could find people playing chess or just taking pics of the square and the view from the top of the city. Worth a visit when you're in
Went on a free Zurich walking tour and was brought to Lindenhofplatz. It's a quiet little park offering a panoramic view of the old town and the river. Worth a walk up there for a good photo!
The views of Zurich are great from Lindenhof. The park itself isn't anything special. A definite must for a great view!

Love this place which up from the old town of Zurich. Where you can get a nice paranomic view from old town and the river. It's just a small walk from the old town, can't see why tourist like me should miss it. :-)
A stroll through the old town and up to the lovely platz where there are wonderful views out and across Zurich. The locals play petanque here as well.

It was hard to find the way up, but if you keep guessing when on the path, you'll find your way up to Lindenhofplatz if you head in this direction on the map. Great place to just sit and watch the river.
Great view of the river and Aldstadt. The big fountain there has very drinkable water so fill up your water bottle. Nice place to rest.
Great spot to cool down after a walk through the shops and enjoy views of Zurich. The Linden trees provide good shade and there are quite a few benchmark around

We found the place by accident while strolling through the city. It's peaceful, chilled with great view over the river. We had a great weather which is the way to do it.
Great views of the city and river. Fountains. Boules. Huge chess boards. Leafy trees and benches. Zurichers and tourists alike seem to enjoy it
That was good to walk and sit in the park of Lindenhof to rlax and enjoy the view over the 2 sides of the city

The Lindenhof hill is my favorite spot in the heart of the city for views of the Limmat River and the Old Town. This is where you will spot a Roman tombstone with the first mention of the city of Zurich, a water fountain with a statue salute to female soldiers, a playground, and

We spent a whole day walking through Zurich and this was certainly a worthy stop for the views of the city and water below. You can enjoy sitting and watching friendly locals play games including chess which our children were fascinated by. Definitely worth a visit.

Last week I took some USA chums to my favourite park..Lindenhof...& provided a picnic lunch which I had imagined would be the perfect place to rest as well as enjoy the view...we did neither! Swarms of the dreaded WASPS dived on us (& our food!!) & we had barely begun to eat
Lindenhofplatz is a square located on top of a hill that overlooks Zurich. The square itself isn't too special, however, the view of Zurich is fantastic. Well worth it to come here!
This is a great spot to get a good view of the city centre. Two minutes walk from Banhofstrasse, you will enjoy a nice view of the river.

Lindenhof is small and understated, but a real gem. There are benches, some which a good view. There are many shade trees. And there is information about how this park dates back to Roman times. Linger here and soak up the atmosphere.

A short uphill walk for great views. Sunday afternoon, the park is filled with locals yet quiet and enjoyable. Have a seat on one of the benches and enjoy the Limmat River, views of Lake Zurich and the city.
Amazing view and you could just relax and be at peace looking down and enjoying the view from the top.. There are seats for you to take a break Incase you are tired from climbing to the top
One can have a good view of the Limmat river below & the old part of the Zurich city. In the evening lot of tourists as well as locals come here just to relax & sit here & enjoy beer.
Lovely place to take a seat on the wall, legs hanging down, and just look at the Limmat river and contemplate this beautiful city.
A unexpected Jewel and oasis in a old city . Great view from here . Nice trees and greens . Very relaxing for both tourist and locals
Rather plain and untidy square but good views over the river so worth the short climb up if you are walking round the old town.

Lindenhofplatz is a fantastic vantage point for beautiful views of Zurich city - the river below, the mountains beyond AND the Zurich Lake on the right! It's a short walk up a hill and has shady trees, fountains and benches to sit, chat, relax, read and enjoy a wonderful

It is a very serene place where you can spend some quality time in peace and tranquility. There are beautiful trees in the park. And some benches where you can sit and relax. It has some very good views of the river. Very close to other places of interest (walkable distance)
This higher spot overlooks Zurich and is a great place to pause and take in Zurich. Took many good photos from this place and is easily accessible if you do not mind a bit of a slope and a few steps.

And it's free! A beautiful, tree filled square high up in the old town. Great views across the Limmat to Niederdorf and especially beautiful on a hot day when the shade of the Linden and Chestnut trees is heavenly. But the real reason to add Lindenhof to any Zurich itinerary is

We walked up here during the summer festival and there was lots going on. It was a lovely day so we sat and admired the view of the river and city. It is an interesting walk up through the narrow streets. Would definitely recommend!
Very nice view of the Limmat border of the city. You get there walking through winding picturesque streets. Nice photographic opportunity
This is the place to go if you want to take some stunning pictures of the old city. It is an uphill walk to get there but it is well worth it.

Linderhofplatz is a great park! It has three big chess boards set up for people to play chess or checkers with each other. We played two games with a local student who happened to walk by, and before you knew it, about ten men gathered around to watch, analyze, and cheer each
I absolutely recomend this place!! If you go to Zúrich it's a place with a fantastic views of the city
Great area for relaxing after walking the old town. Great views on Limmat. Watch the locals play petanque.

Uphill park with benches, activities for kids, and nice views of the river. I'd come here before sunset or maybe early morning. Particularly nice with a partner or friends. Maybe bring a book or e-reader. Access from the north or south.
great views of the old city. Easy to get to on foot. Lovely shopping district not very far away, again easy to get to on foot.
Great photo opportunities on the clear and sunny day. Loved the architecture, the water, and the views.

By far, the best view of the city. Checked out the view from the university, whose terrasse was also recommended as a viewpoint, but was disappointed. Lindenhofplatz is where you want to view the city.

While strolling in the center of Zurich don't miss this beautiful panorama of the river and the old city. It is a very nice public garden (with free toilets) located on a hill above the river. we walked up after visiting the Giacometti hall at the police headquarters near by,

If by this time in the tour you need a WC, exit the park using the stairs on the right at the back of the park and turn right at the bottom of the stairs. A free, very clean public WC is at the bottom to the stairs.

We came from south watched some people playing chess on the west side and then took some view pictures to the Limat river and the old city in the east side. And this is it. 10 - 15 minutes as part of a walk in the old city.

Visited briefly with my husband. Great views down the river. We had he luck of the weather so enjoyed a sit down to enjoy the moment. I think you can get similar views at other points on the river too.

This is truly a gem of a place to be at. I just love the serenely relaxing atmosphere complimenting the excellent vantage view of the Old Town across the Limmat River. It just makes me forget about the arduous walk up the steep roads to get there. Even sitting on one of the

definitely worth a walk, which goes through old city to this hill with Linden trees (= lime trees). Top of hill is Lindenhof. On one side is a church which is reputed to have largest church tower clock in Europe. Church is open to public. Outside it is an area where anyone can

We were exploring the city on foot and came upon this little park on the top of a hill by chance. We followed a charming street up the hill, then some stairs a little bit more up, and, voila, the park appeared on our left unexpectedly. We had been walking the city for a while,

I keep believing this is the secret center of town: right in the middle you climb up the hill, best is from the Rennweg and then down to the other side along the river. In summer very relaxing under the shadow of the trees, while enjoying the view into the Niederdorf, the river
this spot has one of the best views of zurich old town. it is a green area in the middle of the city overlooking the old city and the limmat river.
Short walk up a few streets from the water. Great view, small park with giant chess boards and beautiful trees. Worth a stop while walking around
From here you have a breathtaking view of the old town, the Limmat river and the cathedral. It is a quiet area where you can see zuriqueses playing chess or petanque.

This small hill is very close to the station.You can easily go up the hill.There are steps to climb so it s not tedious.You can relax here and view the city and also see the stunning Limmat river.After walking through the city here you can take a break.The view is spectacular
This is probably the most underestimated viewpoint in Zurich. The view is awesome and it is very easy to get there because it is in the heart of town. Do not miss it when walking close to Limmat.
This park area is at the top of a hill. Great views looking east across the river. Lots of trees and shaded areas. Quite peaceful.
Unfortunately it was raining when we were here but it was still a great view of the city. Worth the walk up there to see the view!
Just a small park to chill out and watch the river. Good for 10 minutes or if you have a book. Kids might enjoy.

If you want a good view of Zurich and are only in the city for the day, this is the place to come to as it is just minutes walk from Bahnhofstrasse. But, it get crowded with tourists and local youths and smells of cigarette smoke all the time.
One should visit this park without reservation. The vantage point over the old town is remarkable and is a fantastic place to visit for a picnic or beer (you must bring). MUST SEE!
This is my favourite place. I love the view from here. You can find it when you are wandering around the old town. Just such an amazing little place with an incredible view of the city of Zurich!

Every summer, I play boccia there with my friends. There is plenty of space, nice people around and so far never complained when we had our one-way bbq grill mounted and the sausages prepared (of course we always leave the spot clean).
The Lindenhofplatz is not only beautifully located on the River Limmat, but is also a valuable historical place
Nice place to relax for all ages. It has a nice view to the old Zurich, nice play grounds for children and ground chess for all ages. Public access all the time.

It’s a must place to visit in Zurich. It’s about 15 minutes walk from main train station. Just take a walk along the river, untill Rudolf-Brun-Brucke bridge, you can find small road and turn right at Fortunagasse, take few step to the hill. Nice place to see Old town from this

You will want to spend some time up at the Lindenhofplatz. It has a panoramic view of Zurich as well as some great park benches to soak it all in.

The place is big with lots of tree's and bank's to sit on. You have a great view over the old city, the Limmat canal and the church of Grossmünster. You can relax here and children can run around and play, you can play petanque and picknick.
This is a short and easy walk from anywhere in the old town area. Terrific views without any cost or major effort. If you want some nice pictures you can get them here.
This is a little hill where one can enjoy a picturesque view. It looks like you are looking at a post card. It is a good place to sit and appreciate what history left behind.
A little climb up but worth it for the views over the river. Nice relaxed park. Great place to sit and relax if your feet are a little tired from the walk around the old town.

To be honest, I had to be dragged out of there :). We had no idea where we where when we first got there. We were just walking around the old city, crossed one of the bridges, up some stairs and then, one of the most beautiful views of the city was in front of us. You can see
It's one of the key spots from which you can admire the city. You get a view of the old city centre, along the Limmat river. It's a quiet and relaxing place... And it's free!

This small hill in the city centre Zurich is where I normally start the old town (Altstandt Zurich) tour with my guest(s) or my weekend strolling. Surrounded by Zurich HB (Central Station), Limmat (river), Bahnhofstrasse and as far as Lake zurich this moraine hill is a part of
The scenery of this old city is graphic and it a very well maintained area! Lots of people walking around enjoying the vibes! You can enjoy a coffee/ drinks/ food around this historical area!
No visit to Zurich is complete without climbing up here. Situated on the Roman mount. We went during Sechsalautern so full of tents selling beer, wine, sausages etc. Great atmosphere

Just a short distance from the main station. Sat on a bench to have some food. Watched some old folk playing a game of chess with life-sized pieces. The view is great, though somewhat obstructed by A large structure in the centre. A great place to have a short break
This is a hill at the center of Zurich,very easy accessible from HB and Banhofstrasse.Great view of the city and the Limat river.Go!
This is a brilliant location in the middle of the old city where you can enjoy some piece and quiet and great views of the Limmat and of the old town.

The place is quite near the main railway terminus. It has its own lovely character and the walk is also quite interesting. View of the city and river below are most refreshing. Overall a relaxed place

Main point in Lindenhof area is Lindenhofplatz(sightseeing place up on a little hill). There you can enjoy great views over the city and and River Limmat.10-15mins walk from Main Railway Station, wear comfy shoes because there are some cobblestone streets. Climb is not that bad,
It does take some efforts to climb up but the view is fantastic. Bring some food and drinks and have a picnic alongside the great view -- free luxury.

There are few places where you can enjoy great views and this side of the River Limmat, Lindenhofplatz is the best. 10-15mins walk from Main Railway Station, wear comfy shoes because there are some cobblestone streets. Climb is not that bad, so good for elderly people too. From
Good for several hour visit. The castle has many features that you need to take your time to visit. Take the tour if possible.
The views of the Old Town and the Limmat from Lindenhofplatz is fantastic. Nice place to relax and spend some time resting after a busy sight seeing of the city
